captainStory.title: A Tribute to Captain Diego Domínguez Escobar
captainStory.subtitle: Where Aviation Legacy Meets Caribbean Paradise
captainStory.story: Cabaña Sancibrian honors the life and legacy of Captain Diego Domínguez Escobar, whose spirit of adventure and exploration lives on in every corner of this beachfront retreat. faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Everything you need to know before your adventure.

items.question: How do I get to Sapzurro?
items.answer: The fastest route is flying to Acandí airport (1h from Medellín), then a short boat ride to Sapzurro (30-40 min). Alternatively, fly to Apartadó or Montería, ground transport to Necoclí (2-3h), then speedboat to Sapzurro (1.5-2h). We can help coordinate all transportation.

items.question: What's included in my stay?
items.answer: Accommodation with Starlink WiFi, 24/7 electricity, hot water, premium linens and towels, and access to Hangar Café. Breakfast and other meals available upon request.

items.question: Is there cell phone signal?
items.answer: Cell signal is limited and depends on your carrier. However, we offer high-speed Starlink WiFi to keep you connected.

items.question: What's the best time to visit?
items.answer: Sapzurro is beautiful year-round. December-March offers less rain and better weather. April-November has more rain but fewer tourists and greener nature.

items.question: Can I work remotely from the cabin?
items.answer: Absolutely! We're designed for digital nomads. Starlink internet, 24/7 power, spacious desk, and Hangar Café coworking space make it perfect for remote work.

items.question: Is Sapzurro safe?
items.answer: Very safe! It's a small fishing village with a friendly community. The main risk is falling in love with the place and never wanting to leave!

sapzurro.title: Sapzurro: The Caribbean's Best-Kept Secret
sapzurro.subtitle: At the Crossroads of Continents
sapzurro.description: Nestled in the heart of the Colombian Darién, Sapzurro is a small fishing village where the jungle meets the sea. Accessible only by boat, this paradise offers a unique experience of total disconnection.

howToGetHere.title: Your Journey to Paradise
howToGetHere.subtitle: All roads (and boats) lead to Sapzurro
howToGetHere.intro: Sapzurro is accessible only by boat, making it a true hidden paradise. The journey is part of the adventure! We can help coordinate your transportation from any starting point.

steps: Flight to Apartadó (45 min) or bus (8h)
Shared van to Turbo (1.5h) or Necoclí (2.5h)
Boat from Acandí to Sapzurro (30-40 min)
routes.note: Fastest route! Limited flight schedules, check availability in advance

steps: Ground transport to Turbo (1.5-2h) or Necoclí (2-3h)
Bus to Montería (6h) or flight (45 min)
Go to the maritime terminal in Turbo
Boats depart daily in the morning
routes.note: Turbo is an alternative departure point to Necoclí. Multiple boat companies operate daily routes.
Popular stopover for sailors heading to Cartagena

tips: Boats depart mainly in the morning (6-8 AM)
Bring cash: ATM in Capurganá but not always working
Pack light: maritime transport has luggage limits
Use biodegradable sunscreen to protect our reefs
Bring your passport if you want to visit La Miel (Panama)
